name: places/ChIJZ4jI_EFZwokRAa91eVQSjUI
formattedAddress: 26 E 17th St, New York, NY 10003, USA
adrFormatAddress: 26 E 17th St, New York, NY 10003-1901, USA

originalText.text: Great Meal Pal option. The restaurant is small and has a mild smell of fish but to be expected. Would recommend to people looking for a quick bite near Union Square. The Spicy Salmon Cracked Rice comes with six pieces and four different sauces which all complement the fried rice block.

text.text: Great Meal Pal option. The restaurant is small and has a mild smell of fish but to be expected. Would recommend to people looking for a quick bite near Union Square. The Spicy Salmon Cracked Rice comes with six pieces and four different sauces which all complement the fried rice block.

originalText.text: Service was typical New York begrudging politeness. So good for New York. The rice was warm. Could be a bit more vinegary and sweet, but wss still good. Get three proteins as it is not much more than two. The toppings are typical except two things: the cucumbers are not pickled (boo) but the mushrooms are fantastic. These kinds of marinated shitake were the reason I started eating chirashi many years ago. Overall, good experience and I recommend trying at least once.

originalText.text:
An order of 6 pcs of sushi at 13.99 charged me 15.99 in delivery fees on a Uber Eats plus other fees. A total cost of 35.00 ……Ridiculous!!!! And total highway robbery for sushi that is so subpar.
Will never order from them again!!

originalText.text: Quaint spot great for lunch or any other bites. I came during lunch. I got the crack rice and a salmon bowl. Service was friendly and food was good
